body_html: You're creating both models so that they share variables, which is not possible when vocabulary sizes differ. If you want separate variables for each model, use, e.g., "with tf.variable_scope('enfr'):" when creating one and "with tf.variable_scope('fren'):" when creating the other.
body_text: You're creating both models so that they share variables, which is not possible when vocabulary sizes differ. If you want separate variables for each model, use, e.g., "with tf.variable_scope('enfr'):" when creating one and "with tf.variable_scope('fren'):" when creating the other.
body: You're creating both models so that they share variables, which is not possible when vocabulary sizes differ. If you want separate variables for each model, use, e.g., "with tf.variable_scope('enfr'):" when creating one and "with tf.variable_scope('fren'):" when creating the other.
